creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: two pieces of almost semi-circular form covererd with raised loops of bamboo all going horizontally; most of bamboo light in color with wide strip of slightly redder bamboo across center of both
marks: underside support beam on each component, in red i
text: Uematsu carefully looped and wove the bamboo and rattan strips using techniques learned from years of crafting traditional bamboo flower baskets. The subtle design formed by the two tones of bamboo strips calls to mind the iridescent pattern on a butterfly’s wings. The Clark collections are the world’s preeminent repository of works by Uematsu, who in recent years has distinguished himself with large-scale sculptures like this.
title: Butterfly
